intro: Wellstedia dinteri var. gracilior, commonly known as the slender wellstedia, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Namibia and Angola, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces tall, branched inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
